alert.note: Alert for Minnehaha (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:08AM MDT until April 11 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Rock River at Luverne affecting Rock County. Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Split Rock Creek near Corson affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lyon, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Trent affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Union, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Split Rock Creek near Corson. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the parking lot at the racetrack may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Monday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 5.1 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Split Rock Creek Corson 8.5 9.0 Mon 7 am 7.9 7.2 6.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1115 AM CDT.
